verses.verse: And he said<WH559> unto me<WH1121>, Son of man<WH120>, stand<WH5975> upon thy feet<WH7272>, and I will speak with thee<WH1696>.
And the Spirit<WH7307> entered<WH935> into me when he spake<WH1696> unto me<WH5975>, and set me upon my feet<WH7272>; and I heard<WH8085> him that spake unto me<WH1696>.

And he said<WH559> unto me<WH1121>, Son of man<WH120>, I send<WH7971> thee to the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, to nations<WH1471> that are rebellious<WH4775>, which have rebelled<WH4775> against me<WH1>: they and their fathers have transgressed<WH6586> against me even unto this very<WH6106> day<WH3117>.
And the children<WH1121> are impudent<WH7186> and stiffhearted<WH2389>: I do send<WH7971> thee unto them<WH559>; and thou shalt say unto them<WH559>, Thus saith the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>.

And they<WH8085>, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear<WH2308>, (for they are a rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>,) yet shall know<WH3045> that there hath been a prophet<WH5030> among them<WH8432>.

And thou<WH1121>, son of man<WH120>, be not afraid<WH3372> of them<WH3372>, neither be afraid of their words<WH1697>, though briers<WH5621> and thorns<WH5544> are with thee<WH3427>, and thou dost dwell among scorpions<WH6137>: be not afraid<WH3372> of their words<WH1697>, nor be dismayed<WH2865> at their looks<WH6440>, though they are a rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>.
And thou shalt speak<WH1696> my words<WH1697> unto them<WH8085>, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear<WH2308>; for they are most rebellious<WH4805>.

But thou<WH1121>, son of man<WH120>, hear<WH8085> what I say<WH1696> unto thee<WH1961>; be not thou rebellious<WH4805> like that rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>: open<WH6475> thy mouth<WH6310>, and eat<WH398> that which I give thee<WH5414>.
And when I looked<WH7200>, behold<WH3027>, a hand was put<WH7971> forth unto me<WH4039>; and, lo, a roll of a book was therein<WH5612>;

And he spread<WH6566> it before<WH6440> me<WH3789>: and it was written within<WH6440> and without<WH268>; and there were written<WH3789> therein lamentations<WH7015>, and mourning<WH1899>, and woe<WH1958>.
